Identifying Characteristics: Scaleless, fleshy keel running along the midline of the abdomen to pelvic fins
Taxinomically identical to invasive Rudd. A key distinction between these two minnows is the phyangeal teeth
Rudd has two rows of phyrangeal teeth – 3 inner and 6 outer teeth
Golden Shiner has one row of phyrangeal teeth – 5 outer teeth
Another distinction is size: Golden Shiners rarely exceed 10 inches in length; Rudd may grow to twice that length
